title-part.text: AUTOMATIC CONTROL, STARTING, SYNCHRONISATION, OR STABILISATION OF GENERATORS OF ELECTRONIC OSCILLATIONS OR PULSES

note.note-paragraph:
This subclass covers:
- automatic control circuits for generators of electronic
oscillations or pulses;
- starting, synchronisation, or stabilisation circuits for
generators where the type of generator is irrelevant or
unspecified.
This subclass does not cover stabilisation or starting circuits specially adapted to only one specific type of generator, which are covered by subclasses H03B, H03K.

In this subclass, the following expression is used with the meaning indicated:
- "automatic control" covers only closed loop systems.

title-part.text: Stabilisation of generator output against variations of physical values, e.g. power supply
against variations of temperature only

CPC-specific-text.text: of generators comprising distributed capacitance and inductance
by indirect stabilisation, i.e. by generating an electrical correction signal which is a function of the temperature
by using voltage variable capacitance diodes
and a memory for digitally storing correction values
by using a memory for digitally storing correction values
by using frequency conversion means which is variable with temperature, e.g. mixer, frequency divider, pulse add/substract logic circuit
of generators comprising piezo-electric resonators

reference.text: H03L1/021 and H03L1/022 take precedence; oscillation generators with a piezo-electric resonator per se H03B5/32

title-part.text: Constructional details for maintaining temperature constant
Starting of generators
Automatic control of voltage, current, or power
of power
Automatic control of frequency or phase
Synchronisation

reference.text: tuning of resonant circuits in general H03J; synchronising in digital communication systems, see the relevant groups in class H04

title-part.text: using a frequency discriminator comprising a passive frequency-determining element
wherein the frequency-determining element comprises distributed inductance and capacitance
using a reference signal applied to a frequency- or phase-locked loop
using several loops, e.g. for redundant clock signal generation
Details of the phase-locked loop

CPC-specific-text.text: the loop being adapted for reducing power consumption
the loop being adapted to provide an additional control signal for use outside the loop
concerning mainly a recovery circuit for the reference signal

title-part.text: provided with an additional controlled phase shifter

CPC-specific-text.text: and where no voltage or current controlled oscillator is used
the phase shifting device being digitally controlled
the controlled phase shifter and the frequency- or phase-detection arrangement being connected to a common input
the controlled phase shifter comprising coarse and fine delay or phase-shifting means

title-part.text: the reference signal being additionally directly applied to the generator

reference.text: direct frequency synchronisation without loop H03L7/24

title-part.text: concerning mainly the frequency- or phase-detection arrangement including the filtering or amplification of its output signal

reference.text: H03L7/10 takes precedence; frequency or phase detection comparison in general H03D3/00, H03D13/00

title-part.text: using at least two phase detectors or a frequency and phase detector in the loop
the phase or frequency detector generating up-down pulses

CPC-specific-text.text: the up-down pulses controlling source and sink current generators, e.g. a charge pump
the up-down pulses controlling at least two source current generators or at least two sink current generators connected to different points in the loop
Details of the current generators
the current generators being controlled by differential up-down pulses
the source or sink current values being variable

title-part.text: the phase or frequency detector using a sampling device
using special filtering or amplification characteristics in the loop
using a lock detector
using a comparator for comparing the voltages obtained from two frequency to voltage converters
concerning mainly the controlled oscillator of the loop

CPC-specific-text.text: the oscillator being a digital oscillator, e.g. composed of a fixed oscillator followed by a variable frequency divider

reference.text: H03L7/0995 takes precedence; fixed oscillators with means for selecting among various phases H03L7/0814

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising a counter or a frequency divider
and a circuit for adding and deleting pulses
comprising an accumulator
the oscillator comprising a ring oscillator
Selecting a signal among the plurality of phase-shifted signals produced by the ring oscillator
Controlling the number of delay elements connected in series in the ring oscillator
using phase interpolation

title-part.text: for assuring initial synchronisation or for broadening the capture range

CPC-specific-text.text: using an additional control signal to the controlled loop oscillator derived from a signal generated in the loop
the additional signal being directly applied to the controlled loop oscillator
the additional signal being a digital signal
using an additional signal from outside the loop for setting or controlling a parameter in the loop
Resetting the controlled oscillator when its frequency is outside a predetermined limit

title-part.text: using a variable transfer function for the loop, e.g. low pass filter having a variable bandwidth

CPC-specific-text.text: by changing characteristics of the charge pump, e.g. changing the gain
by changing characteristics of the loop filter, e.g. changing the gain, changing the bandwidth
by changing characteristics of the phase or frequency detection means

title-part.text: using frequency discriminator
using a scanning signal

reference.text: tuning circuits with automatic scanning over a band of frequencies H03J7/18

title-part.text: for assuring constant frequency when supply or correction voltages fail

CPC-specific-text.text: or are interrupted
the phase-locked loop controlling several oscillators in turn
by switching the reference signal of the phase-locked loop
the switched reference signal being derived from the controlled oscillator output signal
by using digital means for generating the oscillator control signal
said digital means comprising a counter or a divider

title-part.text: Indirect frequency synthesis, i.e. generating a desired one of a number of predetermined frequencies using a frequency- or phase-locked loop
using a frequency divider or counter in the loop

CPC-specific-text.text: the counter or frequency divider being connected to a cycle or pulse swallowing circuit
the frequency divider comprising a phase accumulator generating the frequency divided signal

title-part.text: a numerical count result being used for locking the loop, the counter counting during fixed time intervals
a time difference being used for locking the loop, the counter counting between fixed numbers or the frequency divider dividing by a fixed number
using a mixer in the loop
using means for coarse tuning the voltage controlled oscillator of the loop
comprising a D/A converter for generating a coarse tuning voltage
using at least two different signals from the frequency divider or the counter for determining the time difference
the frequency divider/counter comprising a commutable pre-divider, e.g. a two modulus divider

reference.text: pulse counters/frequency dividers H03K21/00 to H03K29/00

title-part.text: in which the counter of the loop counts between two different non zero numbers, e.g. for generating an offset frequency

reference.text: H03L7/193 takes precedence; pulse counters for predetermined counting H03K21/00 to H03K29/00

title-part.text: a time difference being used for locking the loop, the counter counting between numbers which are variable in time or the frequency divider dividing by a factor variable in time, e.g. for obtaining fractional frequency division

for fractional frequency division
using a phase accumulator for controlling the counter or frequency divider
using a cycle or pulse removing circuit

title-part.text: with reset of the frequency divider or the counter, e.g. for assuring initial synchronisation
using a harmonic phase-locked loop, i.e. a loop which can be locked to one of a number of harmonically related frequencies applied to it
using more than one loop
with pulse counters or frequency dividers

CPC-specific-text.text: Nested phase locked loops

title-part.text: using a reference signal directly applied to the generator
using energy levels of molecules, atoms, or subatomic particles as a frequency reference

Indexing scheme relating to automatic control of frequency or phase and to synchronisation
Modifications for maintaining constant the phase-locked loop damping factor when other loop parameters change

All digital phase-locked loop
